page.title: 04THE CHURCH
page.content: The church was rebuilt in 1851.It is built of red sandstone and has a double chancel Nave with a north aisle and tower and a mortuary chapel. Its dedication to St.John the Baptist seems to point to the fact that it existed at a very early date in the History of Christian England. The ancient font is perhaps one of the earliest in the country,and a much more modern base was carved in the 14th century.The south doorway and the Eastern side of the nave arcade show that there was a church here in late Norman times. There is a perpendicular window in the tower,though the latter is of 13th Century Workmanship.The whole of the church,except the tower was rebuilt by Sir Gilbert Scott in 1851, when all stones in good order were preserved and replaced.
